docs.lead_paragraph: LIKE students who frantically wave their hands so their teachers will notice them, candidates for the General Assembly are vying for voter attention in the closing days of the campaign. In any gubernatorial election year, legislative candidates have to work hard to compete for attention with the more widely known candidates for governor, senator and representative.

headline.main: How to Be Seen if Voters Aren't Looking

docs.abstract: Article on Connecticut election candidates and issues; focuses on Republican Gary A Franks and incumbent US Sen Christopher J Dodd and Democrat Barbara B Kennelly's challenge of Gov John G Rowland; photos (M)
docs.snippet: LIKE students who frantically wave their hands so their teachers will notice them, candidates for the General Assembly are vying for voter attention in the closing days of the campaign.    In any gubernatorial election year, legislative candidates...

docs.lead_paragraph: A midterm election in search of a moral drove toward a close today in a final, frantic round of television advertisements, get-out-the-vote efforts and coast-to-coast partisan bickering over everything from President Clinton's character to health care and the safety of Social Security for his baby-boom generation. With 36 governorships, 34 Senate seats and all 435 seats in the House of Representatives at stake, neither national party entered the final 72 hours willing to predict major gains or losses in an electoral season that has seen repeated reversals of field and has often seemed overshadowed in Washington by the drama of an impending impeachment inquiry.

headline.main: TV APPEALS GROW FRANTIC AS THE END OF CAMPAIGN NEARS

docs.abstract: Mid-term election draws to close with final, frantic round of television ads, get-out-the-vote efforts and coast-to-coast partisan bickering over everything from Pres Clinton's character to health care and Social Security; at stake are 36 governorships, 34 Senate seats and all 435 House seats, but neither Republicans nor Democrats are willing to predict major gains or losses in shadow of impeachment inquiry; Republican official predicts low to modest turnout absent overarching event; estimates of 20-30 very close races include re-election bids by Sens Barbara Boxer, Alfonse D'Amato and Carol Moseley-Braun; Republicans may gain House seats, but not filibuster-proof majority; photo of Newt Gingrich (M)
docs.snippet: A midterm election in search of a moral drove toward a close today in a final, frantic round of television advertisements, get-out-the-vote efforts and coast-to-coast partisan bickering over everything from President Clinton's character to health...

docs.lead_paragraph: TRUE confessions. Fifteen women are gathered on sofas and chairs in the Veterans Hall of the Southampton Cultural Center, and each has a story to tell. One by one they read aloud from the loose-leafs, notebooks and clipboards where secret moments of their pasts are stored. Sometimes funny, often heartfelt, haunting remembrances.

headline.main: Putting Pain on Paper to Heal Their Hearts

docs.abstract: Article describes scene at cultural center in Southampton, NY, as participants in Herstory, special writers' workshop, share their written memoirs; photo (M)
docs.snippet: TRUE confessions.    Fifteen women are gathered on sofas and chairs in the Veterans Hall of the Southampton Cultural Center, and each has a story to tell. One by one they read aloud from the loose-leafs, notebooks and clipboards where secret moments...

docs.lead_paragraph: IT was over in a flash. But to Amelia Garcia, the dream felt almost real, another painful moment from her waking life. In the dream, Ms. Garcia had to get her children to the baby sitter and herself to work. She hailed a cab and got in. The cabbie told her it would cost $15 to get where she needed to go. ''But I don't have $15!'' she cried. The cabbie drove off, leaving her stranded and penniless.

headline.main: When The Ends Don't Meet; In a City of Fat Cats, Some Wallets Are Paper Thin

docs.abstract: Article describes plight of Amelia Garcia and her two young children in New York City and other low wage earners who try, but find it impossible, to rise above poverty level; photos; graphs (L)
